text.section:
On the filing of a complaint against a civil or military officer who may be suspended or removed from office by the Governor, the Governor:
shall provide to the respondent:
a copy of the complaint; and
notice of the time when the Governor shall hear the complaint;
may summon any witness to testify concerning the complaint, pay the witness a fee of $1 a day for attending, and reimburse the witness for travel expenses incurred in testifying;
may designate one or more individuals to attend on the Governor's behalf any part of any hearing that relates to the establishment of the facts of the complaint; and
may order either party or the State to pay any costs of the proceeding.

The Governor, in the same manner as a court of the State, may enforce:
the attendance of a witness summoned under subsection (a)(2) of this section; or
an order under subsection (a)(4) of this section for payment of costs by a party or the State.
If the State is ordered to pay costs under subsection (a)(4) of this section, the Comptroller shall issue a warrant to the Treasurer to pay the costs.
